intro: Galium subvelutinum var. kurdicum, commonly known as the Kurdish bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky slopes. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported healing properties.
